results.title: A frustrated Zuckerberg makes his biggest AI bet as Meta nears $14 billion stake in Scale AI, hires founder Wang
results.summary: Here is the script: Big Tech just changed EVERYTHING. You won't believe what's happening at Meta right now. Mark Zuckerberg, the CEO of Meta, is making his BIGGEST bet yet. He's putting up a whopping $14 BILLION dollars into Scale AI. That's right, folks, we're talking about one of the most aggressive investments in AI history. But here's the thing - Zuckerberg isn't just throwing money at a problem, he's hiring someone to make it happen. Alexandr Wang, the founder of Scale AI, is coming aboard as a key advisor. And let me tell you, this guy knows his stuff. He's built a reputation as an ambitious leader who understands the inner workings of AI like the back of his hand. Wait, what? That's not all. Wang's team has been working on some of the most advanced AI models out there, and they're about to take on the likes of OpenAI. But why is Zuckerberg so desperate to get in on the action? It's simple: he wants to stay relevant. With everyone else racing ahead in AI innovation, Meta can't afford to fall behind.

results.title: OpenAI releases o3-pro, a souped-up version of its o3 AI reasoning model
results.summary: Here's the script: AI just did something INSANE! Imagine having an AI that can reason like a human, making decisions faster and smarter than ever before. That's exactly what OpenAI has done with the launch of o3-pro, their latest AI reasoning model. But here's the thing - we're not talking about some incremental upgrade, we're talking about a game-changer. o3-pro is the culmination of years of research and development, and it's being hailed as OpenAI's most capable model yet. It's like the difference between a toy car and a real sports car - one gets you from point A to B, but the other takes you there in style and speed. So, what makes o3-pro so special? Well, for starters, it's a version of OpenAI's existing o3 model, which already showed promise. But o3-pro takes it to the next level by enabling humans to ask more complex questions, ones that require actual reasoning and problem-solving skills. Think about it - you can ask o3-pro to explain why a particular law of physics holds true, or how a certain mathematical concept works..

results.title: Snap to launch smaller, lighter augmented reality Specs smartglasses in 2026
results.summary: Here is a script based on the article: AI just did something INSANE! You know how we've been hearing about augmented reality glasses being the future of wearables? Well, the king of AR is about to take it to the next level! Snap, the creators of Snapchat, has just announced that they're ditching their Spectacles brand and introducing a new line of smart glasses called Specs. That's right, folks, no more Spectacles - it's time to upgrade to Specs! But here's the crazy part: these aren't just any ordinary specs. They're going to be smaller, lighter, and more powerful than ever before. We're talking about a sixth-generation of AR glasses that's going to blow your mind! Wait, what? You heard me right. A sixth generation. That means we're talking about some serious innovation. And the best part? These babies are dropping in 2026. That's just two years away! Now, you might be wondering why this matters. Well, let me tell you - the smart glasses market is heating up faster than ever. Companies like Meta and Apple are investing big time in head-worn devices, and now Snap is joining the party.

results.title: Google offers buyouts to employees across the company, including Search
results.summary: Here's a script based on the provided article: "AI just did something INSANE! You know how Google's been making headlines left and right lately? Well, today they're taking it to a whole new level. According to sources, Google's offering buyouts to employees across multiple departments, including their knowledge and information team, central engineering, marketing, research, and communications. That's right, folks, we're talking about some of the brains behind the operation â€“ the ones who make sure you get the answers you need, and the ones who bring home the bacon, financially speaking. "But here's the thing, these aren't just any buyouts. We're talking significant payouts, reportedly up to six figures for some employees. And it gets even crazier. It seems that some teams are being told to return to the office, but only if they live within 50 miles of the location. Think about it, you're essentially getting paid to move closer to work. I mean, who wouldn't want that? "Now, you might be wondering why Google's doing this. Well, it's all about cutting costs.

results.title: Reflections from Sam Altman
results.summary: Here's the script: AI just did something INSANE: it's been a month since the second birthday of ChatGPT, and we've officially entered the realm of complex reasoning! That's right, folks, we're not just talking about generating text anymore - we're talking about having real conversations, making decisions, and learning from our mistakes. But before we dive into all the amazing things we've achieved, let me take a step back and reflect on where we started. It's hard to believe it's been almost nine years since we founded OpenAI. We were driven by a simple yet audacious idea: to create Artificial General Intelligence that could change the world. And boy, was it a wild ride! We set out to crack the code on AGI, and the journey has been filled with twists and turns. We faced countless setbacks, but also made incredible breakthroughs. Did you know that our first chatbot, Eugene, was created using a technique called deep learning? Yeah, it was basically a glorified Siri - but hey, it worked! Fast forward to today, and we're pushing the boundaries of what's thought possible.

results.title: Partial Keyframes
results.summary: Here is a script for a 120-second TikTok video on the topic: "AI just did something INSANE: it figured out that you can animate elements without specifying the start state in CSS keyframe animations. That's right, folks, you can take your animations to the next level with a simple trick. Think about it - when you're writing a CSS keyframe animation, you usually have to specify both the starting point and the ending point. From and to: `@keyframes fadeOut { from { opacity: 1; } to { opacity: 0; }}` But what if you could skip the starting point? Just focus on the ending point? Wait, what? You might be thinking... but isn't that cheating? Won't it break the rules? But nope! If you try it out, you'll see that it still works. It's like the browser is saying, 'Oh, you want me to make it go from 100% opaque to 0%, cool, I got this.' This lil' trick has been hiding in plain sight all along. And I'm not just talking about saving a few bytes off your bundle size. Oh no, this trick opens up a whole new world of possibilities.

results.title: OpenAI announces 80% price drop for o3, its most powerful reasoning model
results.summary: Here is a script based on the provided article: AI just did something INSANE: OpenAI just dropped the price of its o3 reasoning model by an astonishing 80%! That's right, folks, we're talking about a whopping 80% discount on one of the most powerful large language models out there! Now, let me break it down for you. So, o3 is OpenAI's flagship model, designed for complex reasoning and advanced decision-making tasks. It's a game-changer, trust me. But, the catch is, it comes with a hefty price tag - until now. Prior to this announcement, o3 was costing a pretty penny, but today, it's getting a significant price cut. But here's the crazy part: OpenAI isn't just reducing the price, they're also cutting the number of tokens required to use the model. We're talking about a massive 80% reduction in input and output tokens. To put that into perspective, if you were using o3 before, think of it like renting a luxury car. Now, it's like buying a brand new sedan! You get the same features, but at a fraction of the cost.

results.title: OpenAI hits $10 billion in annual recurring revenue fueled by ChatGPT growth
results.summary: Here is a script for a 120-second TikTok video based on the article: "AI just did something INSANE! OpenAI, the company behind the revolutionary ChatGPT chatbot, has officially reached a whopping $10 billion in annual recurring revenue! (Cut to a visual of the OpenAI logo) I mean, think about it - they're just three years old and already crushing it. That's right, folks, their chatbot has been making waves since 2023, and now they're reaping the benefits. But here's the crazy part: their revenue grew from $1 billion to $10 billion in just ONE YEAR. That's a staggering 900% increase! I know, I was blown away too. Now, you might be wondering how they made so much money. Well, it turns out it's not just from selling ChatGPT itself, but also from their business products and API. That's right, they're not just a one-trick pony - they're a multi-faceted tech powerhouse. Wait until you hear this: OpenAI's CEO, Sam Altman, is on the cover of Forbes' 30 Under 30 list. Talk about a meteoric rise to success.

results.title: XRobotics' countertop robots are cooking up 25,000 pizzas a month
results.summary: Here is a script based on the provided article: "AI just did something INSANE! Imagine walking into your favorite pizzeria and being greeted by a robot that can whip up a piping hot pie in under 10 minutes. Sounds like science fiction, right? Well, meet xPizza Cube, the countertop robot that's taking the pizza game by storm. XRobotics, a San Francisco-based robotics company, has created a machine that can churn out up to 100 pizzas per hour. That's like 25,000 pizzas a month! To put that into perspective, if you assume a standard 12-hour workday, that means this little guy could cook about 2,083 pizzas per day. Mind blown? But here's the crazy part - these robots don't just stop at any old pizza. They're designed to work with pies of all shapes and sizes, from classic New York-style to Chicago deep dish. And get this, they can even handle different toppings and sauces on the fly. It's like having your own personal pizza chef, minus the attitude.

results.title: Apple Announces Foundation Models Framework for Developers to Leverage AI
results.summary: Here is the script: "AI just did something INSANE! I'm talking game-changing, paradigm-shifting, life-altering... Apple just dropped some major news at WWDC that's going to blow your mind. They've announced the Foundation Models Framework, a brand-new API that lets developers tap into Apple's massive language models and turn them into their own apps! But here's the crazy part - these aren't just any language models, folks. We're talking about the same ones that power Siri, Search, and other Apple services. And now, developers can integrate those models directly into their own apps, creating an entirely new level of AI-driven functionality. Now, I know what you're thinking - 'wait, isn't Apple always trying to control every aspect of our lives?' Well, not exactly. But what they're doing here is giving developers the tools to create something truly innovative and powerful. Think about it - you could have AI-powered chatbots in your favorite games, personalized recommendations in your social media feeds, or even AI-driven virtual assistants that learn your habits and adapt over time.
